benchmark_details.name: WebLists
benchmark_details.overview: WebLists is a benchmark of 200 data-extraction tasks across four common business and enterprise use-cases, aimed at evaluating AI agents on interactive data extraction tasks from the web.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To robustly measure whether an agent can extract structured data on a diverse set of websites.

data.source: Manual tasks created from real-world data extraction use cases provided by customers of a commercial web automation provider.

methodology.calculation: Recall is calculated as the percentage of gold set items extracted by the agent, precision as the percentage of agent-extracted items appearing in the gold set.
methodology.interpretation: High recall ensures complete dataset extraction, while high precision identifies potential hallucinations.
methodology.baseline_results: BardeenAgent achieves 66% recall overall, with a precision of 72%.
methodology.validation: Evaluation was conducted by comparing agent outputs with manually extracted reference datasets.
